title: Foreign Affairs or Defence Sector visa (subclass 576)
summary: This page provides information for current or pending holders of the Foreign Affairs or Defence Sector visa (subclass 576), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2016. It explains visa validity, rights, obligations, work conditions, and requirements for students and their dependent family members.

visa_details.visa_name: Foreign Affairs or Defence Sector visa
who_this_applies_to: people already granted a subclass 576 visa
people who applied for the visa on or before 30 June 2016 and have not yet received a decision
visa_details.post_closure_instructions: From 1 July 2016, extensions must be made by applying for a Student Visa (subclass 500).
visa_details.visa_verification: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) can be used to check visa details and conditions.

visa_validity.valid_until: expiry date given at time of grant

study_rights: visa holder can study in Australia
eligible dependent family members aged 18 or older can study for up to three months; longer study requires their own student visa

visa_holder: up to 40 hours per fortnight while course is in session
unlimited hours during scheduled course breaks
unlimited hours if the visa holder has commenced a masters or doctorate course
must comply with State and Territory workplace laws
family_members: up to 40 hours per fortnight after the visa holder has commenced their course
unlimited hours if the visa holder has commenced a masters or doctorate course
eligible dependent family members can accompany the visa holder to Australia

student_obligations: must check conditions via VEVO or visa grant letter
students_under_18: must maintain accommodation, support, and welfare arrangements for the duration of the visa or until turning 18

changing_education_provider.requirement: must have a letter of support from DFAT or Department of Defence approving the transfer

no_further_stay_condition.description: Some visas include a condition preventing applications to stay longer in Australia, except in certain circumstances.

must_notify_if: change of phone number, email, address, or passport

requirements: must remain a member of the visa holder’s family during their stay
must work no more than 40 hours per fortnight (unless unlimited hours permitted due to visa holder studying a masters or doctorate)
cannot begin work until the visa holder has commenced their course
must attend school if of school age
family_member_obligations.consequences_of_breach: breach may result in cancellation of the visa holder’s visa and possible requirement to leave Australia
